de.systemagmbh.tools.io.mail
Class CSysSMTPSender

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.io.mail.CSysSMTPSender
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISysMailSender
public final class CSysSMTPSender
extends Object
implements ISysMailSender

The class CSysSMTPSender provides SMTP mailing service. Specified in RFC 821 - Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP). The default mail priority of this implementation is 3 (Normal). The attachments are encoded according to Base64 conventions using de.systemagmbh.tools.comm.CSysBase64. This class is Thread safe.

Version:
$Revision: 1.4 $
Author:
Christian Wohanka, Michael Hogan

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

CSysSMTPSender

public CSysSMTPSender()
               throws UnknownHostException
Default constructor. Calls CSysSMTPSender(System.getProperty("mail.smtp.server")).

Throws:
UnknownHostException - If the IP address of the host could not be determined.

CSysSMTPSender

public CSysSMTPSender(String smtpServer)
               throws UnknownHostException
Creates a new CSysSMTPSender, associated to the specified SMTP server at the default port. Calls CSysSMTPSender(String smtpServer, int port) with the given argument and DEFAULT_SMTP_PORT value.

Parameters:
smtpServer - The DNS name or the IP address of a SMTP server.
Throws:
UnknownHostException - If the IP address of the host could not be determined.

CSysSMTPSender

public CSysSMTPSender(String smtpServer,
                      int port)
               throws UnknownHostException
Creates a new CSysSMTPSender, associated to the specified SMTP server at the specified port. If the server argument is null, it will be set to localhost.

Parameters:
smtpServer - The DNS name or the IP address of a SMTP server.
port - The port the SMTP server is listening.
Throws:
UnknownHostException - If the IP address of the host could not be determined.
